title: How to make a sci-fi film, the easy way
materials_required: 3D models in 3DS, Quake MD2 & MilkShape MS3d format
description: This instructable provides a guide on how to create a sci-fi film using Google Sketchup for 3D modeling and Wax 2.0 for video editing. It covers adding spacecraft and explosions, as well as using greenscreen effects.
steps: Create or find 3D models using Google Sketchup or other software and convert them to .3ds format. Ensure models are well-designed.
Import a background video or image into Wax 2.0. Avoid camera shake in videos.
Import the 3D model into Wax 2.0 using the Model Loader plugin. Add background clip in a lower track.
Animate the model by using the transform 3d plugin. Use keyframes to set the position, rotation, and scale of the model at different points in time.
Set project settings and render the video. Use video editing software like Windows Movie Maker to assemble scenes, add titles, and finalize the film.
For greenscreen effects, film yourself against a green background and import the video into Wax 2.0. Use the chroma key plugin to replace the green background with a different video or image.
Use the particles plugin in Wax 2.0 to create explosions and smoke effects. Adjust the particle settings for different effects like zero gravity explosions, explosions with gravity, and smoke trails.
